title: 2013 Chinese Super League
text:
The 2013 Chinese Super League was the tenth season since the establishment of the <a href="Chinese%20Super%20League">Chinese Super League</a>, the 20th season of a <a href="Professional%20sports">professional</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> league and the 52nd top-tier league season in China. <a href="Guangzhou%20Evergrande">Guangzhou Evergrande</a> won their third consecutive title with an 18-point advantage ahead of runners-up <a href="Shandong%20Luneng">Shandong Luneng</a>.
Promotion and relegation.
Teams promoted from <a href="2012%20China%20League%20One">2012 China League One</a>
Teams disbanded 
Teams relegated to <a href="2013%20China%20League%20One">2013 China League One</a>
Clubs.
Foreign players.
The number of foreign players is restricted to five per CSL team, including a slot for a player from <a href="Asian%20Football%20Confederation">AFC</a> countries. A team can use four foreign players on the field in each game, including at least one player from the AFC country. Players from <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a>, <a href="Macau">Macau</a> and <a href="Chinese%20Taipei">Chinese Taipei</a> are deemed to be native players in CSL.
Hong Kong/Macau/Taiwan players (doesn't count on the foreign player slot)
